title: Make Tryndamere more like a barbarian warrior with a huge sword and less of a saboteur or bandit
body:
slower moving, slower hitting, a wider array of defensive tools and a bigger sword

When Tryndamere attacks 2.5 times a second it kind of destroys the illusion that the sword he's always dragging behind him is heavy or unwieldy.

And watching Tryndamere split push all day and then scurrying off when some heat is coming his way doesn't feel right. It makes him feel like a bandit who wants to vandalize your benches, lightpoles, trees, public spaces, libraries, your yard and your towers, not a barbarian who wants to be surrounded in violence.

325 move speed, 1.25 attack speed cap, replace mocking shout with a channeled block ability so he can team fight without being a binary one button champ, and double his sword size and range and make it feel big and unwieldy. Make it so that his auto attack strikes a linear area in front of him and can miss if enemies step out of it. But if it lands make it smash shit hard. Real hard. Like "I don't give a shit if you stacked armor on alistar ult this shit will fuck you up so get the hell out of the way" hard.

I don't want to make Trynd a Sion duplicate. I don't think "heavy and slow" has to imply juggernaut. I think people associate it with juggernaut and can't imagine a melee carry with that sort of "feel" because all melee carries that have ever been made for this game were narrowly focused on sort of a "blitz" approach of doing as much damage as quick as possible to the most important targets, and then likely dying or snowballing from there. But thats basically an assassin with auto attacks.

I want a proper melee carry. One that does the same job that a ranged carry does. Ranged carries can work because range is a defense that allies can amplify with peel and presence. I want to give Tryndamere an array of defensive tools that when used in conjucntion provide his allies the ability to amplify his Time To Battle, the same way his allies might be able to do so for a ranged champion.

I want Tryndamere to feel like an undying brutal badass in fights but even I can see that you can't just give him the raw power to 1v5 enemy teams. You have to gate some of his power behind the strategy and interaction of his allies. I'm okay with that. As long as it means Tryndamere can be more of what he is supposed to be-- a proper melee carry.
I had an idea where instead of being unable to die he can just come back to the rift faster. Sort of like Diablo in Heroes.

Dungeons and dragons, Diablo, Everquest, Morrowind are examples. You are entitled to disagree about what the barbarian trope is supposed to be or even if it is consistent with itself. I'm not interested in having a debate about it because I am not personally vested in the idea that the trope must mean one thing or another. I said the trope isn't necessarily aligned, which is trivially true.

Whether it is aligned or is not aligned is incidental and irrelevant because different people will submit to different definitions of the trope, since the trope itself is defined indirectly through the media in which is subsists, but that very same media can't be determined to be appropriate examples of the trope unless you have a definition to make that determination if the first place. I won't waste time with arguing about something that is intrinsically circular.

I don't want him to be a juggernaut. I don't want him to be a huge hulking duplicate of Sion.

I want a melee carry who doesn't attack all that fast but hits extremely hard and wide. There is no reason why every melee carry out there has to attack fast, move fast, and focus squishies-- they just start to feel like auto attack based assassins. 

Instead, Imagine a melee carry that moves slow and attacks slow, but has an array of best-in-game defensive TOOLS (not raw stats) that are powerful enough in the ideal circumstances to literally block the entire enemy team's focus fire.

A ranged champion can, with protection, in the ideal circumstances, invalidate the entire enemy team's attempts to counteract. They can leverage their front line and with the assistance of their allies stay just out of lethal range of the enemy team, constantly whittling down enemies that stray near with a flurry of attacks.

I want Trynd to take this approach, except with singularly devastating attacks that strike an area. And instead of "staying just out of range" I want him to be IN range of everything the enemy team can throw at him. His defensive tools should be of such caliber that if he is able to leverage his team in order to wield them to their maximum potential, he has just as good a chance of surviving focus fire as slippery ranged champions do.

The caliber of defense I'm talking about would be like a sword block that has a 2 second cooldown, roots Tryndamere and prevents him from turning, auto attacking, or using spells or abilities while channeling, and blocks everything in a 180 degree in front of him, whether it be crowd control or damage. The enemy could stop the block by getting behind him and either doing so much damage to him he is forced to disengage or ult, or cc him so as to interrupt the channel.

An ability like that would require him to coordinate with his team, because there are some enemy champions that can get behind him and ruin his day. However, if his team is able to protect his flank, he can single handedly protect his vanguard against anything, anything at all. 2 champs, 5 champs, 5 champs a morde ghosts a clone a bunch of heim turrets a baron and tibbers he just doesn't care. He might not be able to move, turn or attack while he's blocking, but you aren't going to do shit to him unless you approach him from more than one angle or can outmaneuver him one on one.

Essentially I'm looking at this from a different perspective. I don't think all melee carries have to do the same job that Yi tries to do, or be as one dimensional.

I posted this in another thread, however I wanted you to hopefully see my thoughts as well, and wasn't sure you would in the other thread.

Just off the top of my head the changes I would suggest would be:

Reduces incoming damage for higher fury
Fury used by all skills (not full bar, but some of it)
Passive Crit removed, using a skill guarantees next attack to be a crit (lower % damage than usual, more when he's at higher fury levels)
Taking damage gives him some rage when he gets low on health
Ult make his fury explode around him after a small delay using up his rage and refilling his health (instead of no health and unkillable)
Slow changed to frontal line with a wide width
Spin moves much further towards enemies, less so moving away from enemies

Just a brief start, keeping in mind his barbarian theme, and his skills do not require huge changes. . . thematically staying roughly the same, just shifting him from a more assassin style play to a more front line style of play. The playstyle is promoted to move toward the enemies by way of the skills and less so about running away, the small delay on full heal from ult means using it becomes gauging the damage of the enemies for what they are going to deal him very important and the detonation makes him want to be in the group of enemies. Seems like everything a Berserker champ wants to do.

Just made this. Tell me how do you feel about it, OP?

I really like most of it, but there are two points I'd have different:

I'd prefer if his auto attacks had range and hit in a linear avoidable aoe, that way we can afford to make them hit harder or ignore even more armor or damage reduction than your rework suggests.

I don't think his current W or the W you suggest really fits what he _needs_ as a champion. The biggest reason Trynd can't work right now in a team fight is that the enemy team has all the control over when Tryndamere ults, essentially putting him on a timer. You can't expect a champion to be so powerful that he never needs more than 5 (or 7 in your case) seconds to make enough impact to compare with the roster. So I'd prefer if W served him to that end, taking some of the control of when he ults out of the enemies hands and into his allies hands.

Thats why I suggested in this thread a stationary channeled sword block that roots him and prevents him from turning but blocks all cc and damage directed at him from one direction. There is clear counterplay here-- get behind him and disrupt him or damage him so much he's forced to move. That kind of weakness can be covered by allies, who can body block and protect Tryndamere's flank. That makes him feel like a proper melee carry, and patently different than the melee carries we currently have.

It makes sense for him to hit hard and often, and quick strikes make more sense on the guy who's dual-wielding hand axes compared to the guy who's dragging around a sword as tall as he is.
Yea im sure turning tyrnamere into a tank teamfighter would go over well with the fans. Ebin idea b8.
Thematically speaking it would make more sense if Olaf and Tryndamere's ults were switched. Balance wise that isn't a good idea.
